item.title: Coronavirus ‘accelerating’ out of control
item.description: New cases of COVID-19 are “accelerating” out of control across most of the world, the head of the World Health Organisation (WHO) has warned.

item.title: Cleary: I’ve got a plan to keep Burton
item.description: Penrith coach Ivan Cleary could mould demoted young gun Matt Burton into a John Sutton type ball playing forward in a bid to keep him at the club long-term.

item.title: Child dies, four injured in truck crash
item.description: A child has died and four people are injured after a truck crash on Friday afternoon at Menangle, southwest of Liverpool in Sydney.

item.title: NSW Blues chasing domestic dynasty
item.description: Winning a record 47th Sheffield Shield title should be just the start for a NSW squad ladened with talent and ready to build “something special”.

item.title: Silver lining for wounded Lions
item.description: The pain of defeat has eased slightly for the Brisbane Lions following better-than-expected injury reports on key pair Hugh McCluggage and Mitch Robinson.

item.title: Proof virus tracking app doesn’t work
item.description: A Melbourne web app developer claims failings in the Government’s COVID-19 tracking app have “dangerously exposed” him and his 15 staff to the wildly infectious disease.

item.title: ASIO’s bold move to thwart lone wolves
item.description: Australia’s domestic spy agency wants beefed-up powers to interrogate suspects as young as 14 and track cars without a warrant to protect the country from lone-wolf attacks.

item.title: Shameful crime reaches 10-year high
item.description: The number of victims of sexual assault in New South Wales has skyrocketed to a 10-year high, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: How JobKeeper props up your suburb
item.description: Calls to extend the JobKeeper payment, which gives $1500 a fortnight to employees of eligible businesses, have heightened after new data revealed the extent to which it is propping up Australian suburbs.

item.title: Cops catch party breach after KFC order
item.description: A Melbourne couple have tried to breach a police checkpoint, four sex workers have been fined and 16 people were caught at a birthday party as police clamp down on coronavirus enforcement.
